children.value: This mechanism ensures that only the weights corresponding to active features are adjusted, and only when the prediction is incorrect. The learning rate

children.html: η\etaη

children.value: controls the step size of each update, allowing the perceptron to iteratively reduce prediction errors.

\begin {align*} w_j &:= w_j + \Delta w_j \ & := w_j + \eta (y_i - \hat y_i)x_{ij} \ &= \begin{cases} w_j &\text{(a) } y_i - \hat y_i = 0\ w_j + \eta x_ij &\text{(b) } y_i - \hat y_i = 1 \ w_j - \eta x_ij &\text{(c) } y_i - \hat y_i = -1 \ \end{cases} \end{align*}

\begin {align*} b &:= b + \Delta b \ & := b + \eta (y_i - \hat y_i) \ &= \begin{cases} b &\text{(a) } y_i - \hat y_i = 0\ b + \eta &\text{(b) } y_i - \hat y_i = 1 \ b - \eta &\text{(c) } y_i - \hat y_i = -1 \ \end{cases} \end{align*}

X = np.array([[1,-1], [-1,-1], [1,1], [-1,1]]) def perceptron_interactive(random_slider, y0_slider, y1_slider, y2_slider, y3_slider, w0_slider, w1_slider, b_slider, lr_slider, epochs_slider): display(Markdown("If you want a Random Value of the weights and the bias put the random value = 1!")), if random_slider == 1: w0_slider = np.random.rand() w1_slider = np.random.rand() b_slider = np.random.rand() display(Markdown(f"Randomly selected weights: w0={w0_slider:.2f}, w1={w1_slider:.2f}, bias={b_slider:.2f}")) y = np.array([y0_slider, y1_slider, y2_slider, y3_slider]) w = np.array([w0_slider, w1_slider]) bias = b_slider lr = lr_slider epochs = epochs_slider # w = [0.1,0.1] # bias = 0 # lr = 0.5 # epochs =5 plt.figure(figsize=(6,6)) for epoch in range(epochs): plt.clf() # Plot points for i, label in enumerate(y): plt.scatter(X[i,0], X[i,1], c='red' if label==1 else 'blue', s=100) # Plot decision boundary x_vals = np.array([-3,3]) if w[1] != 0: y_vals = -(w[0]*x_vals - bias)/w[1] plt.plot(x_vals, y_vals, 'k--') plt.xlim(-3,3) plt.ylim(-3,3) plt.title(f'Epoch {epoch}') plt.xlabel('x1') plt.ylabel('x2') plt.grid(True) plt.pause(0.01) if w[1] != 0: angle_rad = math.atan(-w[0]/w[1]) angle_deg = math.degrees(angle_rad) display(Markdown(f" The slop: m={-w[0]/w[1]:.2f},angle={angle_deg:.2f}, short_in_y={-bias/w[1]:.2f}")) if w[1] == 0: display(Markdown(f" Doesn't exist the hiperplane to separate in 2 class")) # Perceptron update for i in range(len(X)): z = np.dot(X[i], w) - bias y_pred = 1 if z >= 0 else -1 w += lr * (y[i] - y_pred) * X[i] bias -= lr * (y[i] - y_pred) display(Markdown(f" weights in each iteration: w0={w[0]:.2f}, w1={w[1]:.2f}, bias={bias:.2f}")) display(Markdown( "Este es un proceso interactivo de entrenamiento de un perceptrón binario." "Puedes ajustar manualmente los pesos, el sesgo, la tasa de aprendizaje, las etiquetas de salida y el número de épocas, " "o seleccionar valores aleatorios para los pesos y el sesgo.
" "El perceptrón se entrena sobre datos tipo Q = { (P, T) } donde P ∈ {0, 1}² y T ∈ {0, 1}.
